oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Songwriter Session - Ross Copperman - 2018-03-17
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Performance by Ross Copperman from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on March 17, 2018. Includes questions from the audience.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ross Copperman;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Opening comments and performer introduction begin in progress / (03:05) Opening comments from Ross / (04:03) Introduces his first song / (05:07) Performs Setting The World On Fire / (08:31) Talks about the Bruce Springsteen show on Broadway and it's influence on him / (10:00 ) Introduces the next song / (11:08) Performs Break On Me / (14:49) Interacts with audience regarding where they're from / (16:18) Talks about moving to London England to be a recording artist and eventually becoming a songwriter / (18:59) Introduces the next song / (19:40) Performs If I Told You / (23:28) Answers question about writing songs just to be writing them / (25:48) Answers question about writing songs about his spouse / (27:30) Answers question about his process for writing songs / (29:52) Answers question about Dierks Bentley's influence on him / (31:44) Answers question about writing on guitar or keyboard / (32:24) Introduces the next song / (34:12) Performs Female /
(37:57) Talks about his musical instrument history / (38:29) Performs John Cougar, John Deere, John 3:16 / (41:30) Final comments from Ross / (41:41) Walk-out music / (42:31) FILE END
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Copperman, Ross; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
